New Sales Tax Requirements for Certain States

Hello sticker friends! We have sales tax news: Due to changes in state laws/us reaching a nexus threshold for paying taxes, we’re now required to collect sales tax on certain purchases in specific states (ᴗ_ ᴗ。)
Here’s a quick rundown of what’s behind these changes, which states are affected, and how this might impact you. If you are someone who is tax exempt, please find info below as well!

Why the Change?
This update is a result of a 2018 Supreme Court decision in South Dakota v. Wayfair, Inc. In short, this decision allows states to require businesses to collect sales tax based on the volume of sales within that state, even if the business isn’t physically located there. Since then, most states have adopted what’s called “economic nexus” laws, meaning if a business reaches a certain sales or transaction threshold in a state, they’re required to collect sales tax.

Which States Are Impacted?
Many states now have their own rules around sales tax collection, with some differences:

Economic Nexus Thresholds: Most states set a minimum amount threshold. If we reach that threshold in your state, we’re required to collect sales tax on purchases.

Different Tax Rules for Different States: Sales tax rates and regulations vary, so depending on where you are, you might see these charges show up differently.

What Does This Mean for You?
If you’re in a state where these new requirements apply, you’ll start to see sales tax on applicable purchases. To keep things as smooth as possible, we’re using automated tools that calculate the correct tax rate for your location. So if this ruling applies to you, you will see sales tax during check out.

Tax Exempt

If you are a business who is tax exempt, please Contact Us with your tax exempt form and we can get you all set up in our system! 

🌸 🌸 🌸

Taxes are never fun :’) Thank you for y’all’s understanding as well navigate the ding dang tax system. Please reach out if you have any questions!
